TopicTitle: Shelley Space Program: The Early Pioneers. (Starts 8PM EDT)

Articles.Content:
So I have come back with a reworked stream concept to test out. I found that talking about space history is awesome but not really a stream holding kind of awesome. So I am going to continue my streaming, with a historical bent to it, and also invite you to come discuss topics each stream. This week I'm opening it up to discussions on pre-manned flight space pioneers, people like Konstantin Tsiolkovsky, Robert Goddard, and Wernher Von Braun. I'll link their wikis here so you can look them up if you want to know more. If you want to discuss their impacts, your favorite quote or have questions about them you can join the stream at 8 PM EDT tonight, Friday the 27th, 2014. This won't be a hugely formal thing either, I plan on having a few drinks while we chat so feel free to join in!

Stream

Konstantin Tsiolkovsky

Robert Goddard

Wernher Von Braun

Edited June 27, 2014 by Bzerker01
